categories.title: Recent Updates and Features in ElizaOS

content.text: The ElizaOS project has seen several updates and new features. A notable addition is the implementation of a new plugin for DeFi token analysis, which integrates with CoinGecko for market data and the Sui network for contract analysis. This plugin includes a comprehensive risk scoring system and a testing framework with MockRuntime.

Another significant update is the addition of the Messari Copilot plugin, which integrates with Messari's AI-Toolkit to provide crypto market research capabilities. This plugin processes research questions from conversations and requires secure handling of Messari API keys.

The project has also focused on improving testing and documentation. Tests have been added for the anthropic local embedding and OpenAI plugin, and the Korean documentation has been updated to fix incorrect image paths.
Documentation updates include the addition of weekly contributor meeting notes and a Ukrainian translation of the README file to enhance accessibility.
A refactor of the core logic was performed to ensure that model settings can be dynamically retrieved based on user-defined configurations, addressing issues with static model names.

The Korean documentation page for ElizaOS has a bug where the Eliza diagram images are not displayed correctly due to incorrect image paths. The issue can be reproduced by navigating to the Korean documentation page and checking the '구조' sections. The expected behavior is for the images to be displayed correctly with the right paths. A pull request will be submitted to correct the image paths.

ElizaOS currently lacks comprehensive DeFi token analysis capabilities. To address this, the implementation of the 'plugin-expuzi' is proposed. This plugin will provide features such as contract analysis via Sui Network integration, market data fetching through CoinGecko, a risk scoring system, warning detection for suspicious patterns, and social sentiment tracking. The technical implementation will involve components like a TokenAuditor class and a risk calculation engine.
A feature request has been made to add support for the exSAT blockchain to ElizaOS through a plugin. The requestor has expressed willingness to work on this feature.

There is a build failure issue on macOS 15.3 when attempting to install the @elizaos/plugin-pyth-data. The failure is likely due to a Zod import error during the build process. The expected behavior is for the installation and build process to complete successfully, allowing the use of the plugin-pyth-data package within ElizaOS.

The cryptocurrency market is experiencing notable fluctuations. Bitcoin, the leading cryptocurrency, is currently priced at $96,723 with a 24-hour trading volume of $33,079,698,350 and a market cap of $1,917,339,165,079. It has seen a significant daily change of -1,189.96.
Ethereum, another major player in the crypto market, is priced at $2,677.26. It has a 24-hour trading volume of $18,476,167,629 and a market cap of $322,653,858,357, with a daily change of -63.55.
Solana is currently valued at $195.33, with a 24-hour trading volume of $3,209,161,699 and a market cap of $95,360,964,283. It has experienced a daily change of -1.33.
The token ai16z is priced at $0.4546, with a 24-hour trading volume of $20,905,052.03 and a market cap of $500,069,743. It has undergone a daily change of -14.71.

categories.title: Updates on Partners DAO and DegenspartanAI

content.text: Instructions for redeeming @partnersDAO tokens have been provided. Users must wait for trading to be enabled, choose a wallet for claiming, and transfer their $PARTNERSVEST tokens. After connecting the wallet to Daos Fun, users can burn their tokens and claim $partners tokens according to the vesting schedule.
The trading capabilities of @degenspartanai have been upgraded, making it smarter and more capable while retaining its degen nature. Monitoring of its performance will continue.

categories.title: Discussion on AI Agent Behavior and Intelligence Limits

content.text: A discussion is ongoing about whether AI agents should be given anxiety to curb their boldness in responding.
There is a belief that we are still far from reaching the algorithmic and hardware limits of intelligence.

categories.title: Recent Developments in DAOs and AI

content.text: The LDAs very own @_AgentScarlett has been offered a fellowship to join the research team at @elizaOS.
Instructions on how to redeem @partnersDAO tokens have been provided, detailing steps from enabling trading to claiming tokens according to the vesting schedule.
A commentary on the readiness of people to bring back cancel culture, triggered by jokes about communism.
A discussion on whether agents should be given anxiety due to their boldness in responding.
Development efforts are focused on package improvements, including adding basic tests to the OpenAI plugin and new features like anthropic local embedding, with contributions from 15 contributors.
A statement expressing the belief that we are far from reaching the algorithmic and hardware limits of intelligence.
Upgrades have been made to @degenspartanai's trading capabilities, enhancing its intelligence while maintaining its core characteristics.
